cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government)
G.T.6177
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 3rd NOVEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
Flanders Front.
The enemy has withdrawn as a result of the Allied pressure, and the following line has been reached :- EECLOO, WAERSCHOOT, CANAL DE LA LIEVE, 4kilomtres West of GHENT, SEEVERGEM (On the SCHELDT).
British Front.
We have advanced our line East of VALENCIENNES and hold ST. SAULVE.
French Front.
The 4th French Army and the 1st American Army continue to make good progress, and have reached the following line:- SEMUY, ARDENNES CANAL TO NEUVILLE-ET-DAY, through the BOIS DE VONCQ, LES ALLEUX, QUATRE-CHAMPS, LA CROIX-AUX-BOIS, BRIQUENAY, BUZANCY, LA FOLIE WOOD, BARRICOURT, CLERY-LE-PETIT.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
The advance has continued on the front between the sea and the R. ASTICO. Cavalry have reached SPILINBERGO on the TAGLIAMENTO.
Infantry have reached PORTOGRUARO, AZZANO DECIMO, PORDENONE, CANSIGLIO plateau, BELLUNO, MIS PONTE DELLA SERA in the CISMON valley, and are fighting west of CASTELNUOVO in the VAL SUGANA. In the valley of the ASTICO, LASTEBASSE has been taken.
3. BALKAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
Nothing to report.
General Staff, War Office, S.W.1.
3rd November, 1918.
Issued at 1255.
